intro: Scabiosa × janchenii, commonly known as the hybrid scabious, is a perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are hairy and arranged alternately along the stems. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for garden borders and wildflower meadows. Scabiosa × janchenii is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
